I bought this game pretty recently, and I just completed it not to long ago. I must say, this game was amazing. The story was extremely interesting and the graphics are pretty nice for 2007. The puzzles were challenging but in a good way, as it got my brain really thinking about how to complete each test. If you are thinking about buying this game, please do so. I love it, and I'm sure you will aswell.

游戏流程不算长，一直玩半天就能通关，关于测试内容：你需要在被预先设计好的封闭空间里使用传送枪穿越各种障碍关卡，每过一关都挺有成就感。个人觉得也没有传闻中说的这么烧脑，只是有些关卡一开始挺让人摸不着头脑，但仔细观察思考一下就能找到突破口

“Portal” is a great puzzle based FPS game that can be completed in about 3 hours or less depending on your skill level. It also doesn’t take a monster of a PC to run it, so it is accessible to plenty of users.
Getting gold medal in everything was one of the hardest tasks I've ever had in videogames. Felt great after completing it though.

Pero si puedo decir con toda confianza que no dudes en comprarlo, pocos juegos cuentan con esta calidad.

what a good old game. the old sfm hasn't aged perfectly, but its really fun to go back to every once in a while just to play those fantastic puzzles again. makes you miss when valve actually made video games

its loading time isn't excellent on current computers and it does get stuck occasionally, but i cant remember any awful crashes. controller support is finnicky, my portal shooting config was inconsistent and shot the wrong portal in a crucial situation more than once, so test it for yourself first. glados looks startlingly different if you remember her best from the second game, but that's probably not new information. its also regularly on sale in a bundle with portal 2 around the holidays, so don't feel pressured to buy it or 2 at full price.

요즘 쏟아지는 양산형 게임과는 다르게 독창적이며 몰입도가 높다.
분위기 또한 잘 살렸으며, 적절하게 머리를 써야 한다는 점도 마음에 든다.
종장의 전투는 극도의 긴장감을 자아냈으며 뒤이어 나온 엔딩곡은 많은 여운을 남겼다.
난 세일때 샀지만 이 게임은 만원 값은 한다, 오랜 시간이 지난 지금도 여전히.

such a simple concept and mechanic, padded with the idea of being a lab rat, creatively written with occasionally fun monologues, turned into a brilliant puzzle game.

while the early stages are easy, the later ones requires you to put in a bit more brainpower. it is sadly, a bit on the short side, although there are still a number of bonus levels for you to pit your skills against if you want a longer experience in the world (or lab even). all in all, lots of fun, and pretty clear why it's a classic.

传送门绝不仅仅止步于传送。

之前实验室的电梯像是在上升，实际上越挖越深，通过层层关卡以后居然要送我回炉重造？开玩笑吧。
心疼我方块小可爱。。。当时让我焚烧它我是拒绝的。试了把周围所有的监视器堆在按钮上妄想替换方块的重量，但是——按钮都不带动一下的，怀疑监视器都是空心的。
结局可以说是挺沉重，但是重见光明之后又有一些幽默。谢谢大家的cake了，感谢大家都在。
ps.【玩之前真没想到会带着故事情节的=。=还以为就是实验结束以后开始闯关。（x】

psss. 中文翻译很良心，最后结局的那首歌可以说是非常可爱了xD

In [i]Portal[/i] you play as Chell, a test subject that has just been revived in a test chamber at Aperture Laboratories. As a test subject, Chell will be put through a series of puzzles and tests as she reaches the end of the course. She uses a portal gun, the main mechanic of the game, that allows her to place portals, a kind of wormhole system, on certain types of walls allowing instantaneous transportation from different parts of a single room. Along the way she is harassed by GLaDOS, Aperture's artificial intelligence that seems to control the whole operation.

This is mainly a puzzle game. During play you are exposed to a series of different levels and have to figure out how to get through each one. You have the aforementioned portal gun that you must use and understand how it works to be effective. Physics also play a part as well, such as timing of jumps and so on.

The game is on the shorter side. The first play-through will likely take at least a few hours considering the amount of time it takes to figure out the puzzles. But the shorter length of the game actually turns out to be one of its strengths. It is definitely not the type of game that feels like it overstays its welcome. Every level you go through introduces something new to do, so there is no feeling of repetitiveness or getting bored. The puzzles themselves are challenging enough to be fun, but not too challenging as to frustrate the player.

Being a 10 year-old game, the graphics may not be up to par with what one would expect by today's standards. However, this actually turns out to be a strength of the game as well. The environments in the game are typically clean-cut test chambers, so it is never anything graphic-intensive. This is especially helpful for me as I do not have a souped-up gaming machine, but [i]Portal[/i] runs perfectly smoothly on my more standard-fare laptop.

The writing is also a surprisingly strong aspect of this game, despite it primarily being a puzzle game. There are only two real characters, Chell and GLaDOS, with Chell being a silent protagonist. However, GLaDOS, portrayed by Ellen McLain, adds a certain black humor to the game with her often sarcastic comments. It is certainly a great addition to the game and really helps make it much more memorable than a standard puzzle game would have been.

[i]Portal[/i] is a true classic video game from Valve. It is a must play for anyone that likes puzzle games. Its short length makes it easy enough to get through in a day, or even less, but the achievements available do allow for some replayability.
What a great game! Genius use of the physics, and a really cool character. It's very enjoyable. I can definitely recommend it.

Great puzzle game which makes your brain churn and think in new ways. Portals, jumps, inertia, platforms, lasers, gun turrets and triggers all come together to make a consecutive series of great puzzles with a very smooth and fun difficulty curve, all with a great chunk of humour thrown in there.

The replayability is not great, as the puzzles become very easy once you're used to the way Portal wants you to think.

Buy the Portal bundle and get the sequel while you're at it and you'll have a good few nights of pure video games fun.

Portal has to be one of the greatest games to have ever come onto the Steam store.
While being slightly short, the game has a great amount of puzzles (Well actually the entire game!) and a dark story hidden beneath the surface. I found the first twelve levels reasonably easy but the last 3 or so required some thinking. I loved the cute and yet bloodthirsty gunbots with their somewhat odd remarks when defeated and GLADOS's awkward humour added to the experience. I found the the graphics a bit off but then for ten years ago they are amazing! There is a real moral to the story though, GLADOS only has one thing in mind, get it done, with no concern for how Chell feels about this. This is what the world would be like without ethics. Science looks for control and order but without ethics there is no control and order.
The only downside I felt was that the last battle was pretty dull and easy compared to the levels beforehand.

WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

I quite literally finished the game several seconds ago.

My first thought was, "... That was it?"

My second thought was, "... That... I guess that was it."

My third thought was, "Holy shit, they have Portal 2. I have to buy that NOW."

The first installment of Valve's Portal was surprisingly short. I played perhaps 3 hours of it prior to finishing the game. However, in these 3 hours, I have experienced something so damn refreshing in video games, I almost willed myself to forget everything simply so I could play it again: its originality.

No one has ever concieved such a weapon as a portal gun prior to Valve, and if they had, no one has heard of it. It's such a remarkable tool, on such interesting maps; I quite loved it. You were given a story, a ton of puzzles, and a brilliant concept that I have no doubt was fleshed more fully out in Portal 2.

I feel that the first Portal was an experiment with the overall concept. The story is simply too short, and what I expected to be the prologue was the entire game itself.

Don't get me wrong; the story is fascinating. It's all simply... too short.

But, it's still a good run for your money. You have to complete 19 puzzles in all, including some extras. The graphics are nothing to boast about, but they are high quality enough for you to still be completely immersed inside the game. I recommend it to anyone who has time on their hands and a love of puzzles.
Game is fantastic and has held up really well too. Only complaint is that it ends too soon.
